intro: Notocentrum arboreum, commonly known as the tree hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates.
